textPlain: great to learn from the headline that this tech only works for disaster response maps, and isn't usable for other types of maps, like mapping out the front lines of a war

Reminds me of a project [0] that we spun up in a few days in a hackathon. We finetuned CLIP to be able to work with satellite imagery. Inference was extremely fast.[0]: https://github.com/arampacha/CLIP-rsicd
I love that we are doing this but I hate that we aren't fixing the root cause of most natural disasters we will be seeing in the coming centuries.
I always thought drones could be very veeery useful for fires as well (not only floods)
Also can detect unapproved changes to your home or anything an insurance company believes makes your property more risky to insure.
